alfredsnippet.snippet:
"... it has now been proposed that the extra dimensions of string theory may not even be microscopically small, which has been the long accepted mathematical trick used by advocates to explain why we may not yet detect them.  Instead, they could be large enough to house entire other universes with potentially different laws of physics, and perhaps even objects that, like the eight-dimensional beings in a Buckaroo Banzai story, might leak into our own dimensions."

- Lawrence M. Krauss, Science and Religion Share Fascination in Things Unseen, NY Times, November 8, 2005
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - The Science Fiction Nature of String Theory
